column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=A polycrystalline Sm1.25Fe11Ti ingot was prepared by
#Text=melting high-purity elemental constituents in an induction
#Text=furnace under a purified argon gas atmosphere.
#Text=The Sm-rich
#Text=off-stoichiometric composition was used to compensate for
#Text=the evaporation losses during sample preparation.
#Text=By using an
#Text=arc-melting setup, the ingot was suction-cast into rectangular
#Text=slabs of ∼0.5 mm thickness to ensure rapid solidification and
#Text=cooling.
#Text=After suction casting, the composition was checked
#Text=by using energy-dispersive x-ray spectroscopy in the scanning electron microscope.
#Text=The bulk composition of the ingot
#Text=was Sm7.7Fe85.5Ti6.8, i.e., the stoichiometry of the material
#Text=was closer to SmFe11.1Ti0.9, i.e., with a slight excess of Fe.
#Text=Hence, hereafter, the composition of the alloy is referred
#Text=to as SmFe11.1Ti0.9.
#Text=The suction-cast slabs were wrapped in Mo foil, sealed in quartz ampules under Ar atmosphere, and
#Text=annealed at 1175 °C for 30 min to homogenize the sample and
#Text=stabilize the Sm(Fe, Ti)12 (1:12) phase.
